text:
Hi everyone,

I hope this message finds you well. We are seeking assistance with an issue that has arisen following our transition from using Hapikey (v2 version) to a Private App (v3 version) for our API calls. Since making this change, we have encountered a problem with tracking Google and Facebook leads in our HubSpot contacts list.

Previously, when we used a [specific code], tracking for contacts originating from Google functioned correctly for v2 version. However, after switching to v3 version, the tracking no longer seems to differentiate properly between Google and Facebook leads. Instead, [specific code] appears to aggregate contacts from both sources under a single filter in the HubSpot contacts list, particularly under the "Original source drill-down 2" filter option.

Could you please help us resolve this issue so that we can correctly track and differentiate leads coming from Google and Facebook separately as we did before?

Your prompt attention to this matter would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your help and support.

Hi everyone!

I'm kind of new to HubSpot but I'm trying to make a integration between webflow and HubSpot to sync the CMS knowledge base data, but I can't find the right knowledge base webhooks or API calls to fetch this data. This got me wondering if this was currently possible with the API? Sounds like a pretty straight forward use case.

Thanks in advance for the help!
Knowledge Base APIs are not yet available <@U076V4EC1DY> unfortunately as far as I know

Yeah I just found this, sad :confused:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/HubSpot-Knowledge-Base-API/idi-p/210116/page/2#comments>
I wonder if you could use a graphql query  - I have not experimented with using graphql yet so I don't know but I would look into that perhaps
It might help to include some of the code you're using so we can see the issue.
Hello everyone!

Hello,

Is there a way to find out how many contacts / companies or other records user has through API call?

For example, I need somehow to find out how many contacts user has.
Good morning, does anyone know how to make a call to the API to get the deal ID related to a contact, that is, the deals associated with a contact?

Hey everyone! Is there an easy way to have the Meeting Creations start times and end times be changed from a datepicker to the form that HubSpot wants/needs it? (which are necessary for the creation of meetings through the API)
 like this 2024-06-06T08:00:00.111Z

Like when i try to create the date property above it, its really a hassle ( i do it over a workflow with format data blocks)

Is it easier when you do it over custom code or is it also a hassle to format the custom datepicker property in custom code? :open_mouth:
Appreciate all the insights! :slightly_smiling_face:

I'm cross posting from <#CBA9UA4EN|javascript> because I'm hoping someone has worked with Segment + HubSpot, preferably on the Custom Event Completion endpoint!
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CBA9UA4EN/p1717685235779949>

Call the read contact endpoint (/crm/v3/objects/contacts/{contactId}) with the associations parameter set to ["deal"] - this will give you the association record which contains the deal ID.  Then you can call the read deal method in the same manner.  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>
Thanks Scott

sorry for late response,  been on vacation :slightly_smiling_face:
why not use graphql?

Hi, <@UD53A9UUR>
Thank you for your reply.
How can I use graphql to the HubSpot?
let me get some info for you
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/query-HubSpot-data-using-graphql>
not sure what subscription tier you are working with though
<@U01QVR44MEY> wrote a nice blog post on it as well <https://developers.HubSpot.com/blog/reducing-HubSpot-requests-utilizing-batch-api-and-graphql-for-better-optimization|here>

Is it just me or is the documentation for <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/webhooks#webhook-payloads|webhook payloads> incorrect? Specifically, there’s no mention of `sourceId`, but it is coming in on a `deal.propertyChange` webhook,  There’s also no mention of `subscriptionType` but there is a `eventType` which sounds the same.

there is a feedback form at the bottom of the page.
for the question "was this article helpful?", select no and you should be able to provide your comments :slightly_smiling_face:

<@U05GZLM4DMH> you are correct. It’s wrong. :slightly_smiling_face:

I also submitted it Dennis.

Hi everyone, I'm using this API to Subscribe contact.
<https://api.hubapi.com/communication-preferences/v3/subscribe>
But I got an error message like this. Can someone help me on this:
```{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Subscription 109683698 for huynguyen@everfit.io cannot be updated because they have unsubscribed",
    "correlationId": "da858293-6307-4562-8a52-6a90f54f6e6c",
    "category": "VALIDATION_ERROR"
}```
Is anyone having issues with webhooks right now or is it just me? I'm making changes on a contact and company with property changes subscribed and not seeing anything fire off.
ok now I see some of the webhooks and the occurredAt is 30 minutes ago. wild.
recent changes still aren't firing off webhooks.
We haven't seen any new webhook triggers in the past 4 hours for us. Still investigating...
